page.title: 12Old Tollesbury
page.content: Our village was around before William the Conqueror wrote the first Domesday Book. St Mary's church was built about 1000 years ago, it was built beside the Village Green which was the centre. Bohuns Hall is an old house and there are some 18th century houses round the Green. We have an old "Lock_up" by the church where criminals were kept. In Woodrolfe Rd there used to be a level crossing which the "Crab & Winkle" railway ran through. In the old days most people in the village were fishermen. The men wore smocks with the name of their boat on . They used to say that there was a secret passage from the church to monks house. An old person gave us this information.
